title: Addressing Threats to the United States by the Government of Brazil

enrichment.summary: This executive order declares a national emergency due to harmful actions by the Government of Brazil that threaten U.S. national security, economy, and free speech protections. It imposes a 40 percent tariff on certain Brazilian imports to address these threats and authorizes U.S. officials to monitor the situation and take further actions as needed.
potential_concerns: The imposed 40 percent tariffs on Brazilian imports may increase costs and disrupt supply chains, negatively affecting technology workers and employees of U.S.-headquartered corporations dependent on Brazilian markets.
Coercion of U.S. social media companies to comply with foreign censorship demands threatens the free speech rights of U.S. citizens and could undermine constitutional protections.
Retaliatory trade actions by the Government of Brazil could further harm U.S. businesses and workers in affected industries, exacerbating economic harms.
Efforts to safeguard free expression and national security might inadvertently strain diplomatic relations, impacting U.S. economic interests and future cooperation with Brazil.
